word_mean: 蜱，壁虱：蜱亚目(Ixodidea)蜱总科中吸血性寄生虫，比其相关的螨类大，有硬蜱(Ixodeae)和软蜱(Argasideae)两科，前者包括蝙蝠属(Antricola)、锐缘蜱属(Argas)、耳蜱属(Otobius)、钝缘蜱属(Ornithodoros)等属
后者包括花蜱即钝眼蜱属(Amblyomma)、暗眼蜱属(Anocenter)、盲花蜱属(Aponomma)、牛蜱属(Beophilus)、革蜱属(Dermacentor)、血蜱属(Haemaphysalis)、璃眼蜱属(Hyalomma)、硬蜱属

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb in the sense 'pat, touch'): probably of Germanic origin and related to Dutch tik (noun), tikken (verb) 'pat, touch'. The noun was recorded in late Middle English as 'a light tap'; current senses date from the late 17th cent
Old English ticia, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch teek and German Zecke
mid 17th cent.: apparently short for ticket in the phrase on the ticket, referring to an IOU or promise to pay
late Middle English: probably Middle Low German, Middle Dutch tēke, or Middle Dutch tīke, via West Germanic from Latin theca 'case', from Greek thēkē

encyclopedia.content: 英语单词 tick 英音：[tik] 美音：[tIk] 名词 n. [C]1. 锛堉樱淼鹊娘級滴答声 Each tick of the clock was bringing the fatal hour nearer. 随着时钟的每一个滴答声，关键的时刻越来越近了。 2. 英锛埡硕酝瓯虾蠡娘級记号，勾号 He put a tick beside each word in the glossary that he had learned by heart. 他在词表中每一个已熟记的生词旁做个记号。 3. 英口一瞬，片刻 I'll be with you in a tick. 我一会儿就跟你来。

entry.def: A tick is a written mark like a V: ✓. It is used to show that something is correct or has been selected or dealt with.

example.ex: His exercise books were full of well deserved red ticks...
example.tran: 他的练习本上尽是些红钩钩，都是他应得的。

example.ex: Place a tick in the appropriate box.

entry.def: If you tick something that is written on a piece of paper, you put a tick next to it.

example.ex: Please tick this box if you do not wish to receive such mailings...
example.tran: 如果你不想收到此类邮件，请在这个方框里打钩。

example.ex: As each boy said yes, he ticked their name.
example.tran: 随着男孩们依次答到，他在他们的名字旁打了钩。

entry.def: When a clock or watch ticks, it makes a regular series of short sounds as it works.

example.ex: A wind-up clock ticked busily from the kitchen counter.
example.tran: 一只上了弦的钟在厨房的案子上嘀嗒响个不停。

entry.def: The tick of a clock or watch is the series of short sounds it makes when it is working, or one of those sounds.

example.ex: He sat listening to the tick of the grandfather clock.
example.tran: 他坐在那儿，听着落地式大摆钟嘀嗒作响。

entry.def: You can use tick to refer to a very short period of time.

example.ex: Just hang on a tick, we may be able to help...
example.tran: 稍等一会儿，我们或许能帮上忙。

example.ex: I'll be back in a tick...

entry.tran: (某人的思想、愿望或情感使其)做出…举动;有…的行为
entry.def: If you talk about what makes someone tick, you are talking about the beliefs, wishes, and feelings that make them behave in the way that they do.

example.ex: He wanted to find out what made them tick...
example.tran: 他想搞清楚他们为什么会那样。

example.ex: I'm interested in how people tick.
example.tran: 我对人们的所思所想很感兴趣。

entry.def: A tick is a small creature which lives on the bodies of people or animals and uses their blood as food.

example.tran: 杀灭蜱和螨虫的化学品

example.ex: Tick bites can cause Lyme disease.
example.tran: 被蜱叮咬会引发莱姆病。

sentences.sentence: "he counted the ticks of the clock"

means.word_mean: 2. any of two families of small parasitic arachnids with barbed proboscis; feed on blood of warm-blooded animals
3. a mark indicating that something has been noted or completed etc.;

sentences.sentence: "as he called the role he put a check mark by each student's name"

means.word_mean: 1. make a clicking or ticking sound;
2. make a sound like a clock or a timer;
4. put a check mark on or next to;
